page.title: 11ROUNDS GREEN LIBRARY,OLDBURY
page.content: Rounds Green Library was built in 1966. There are three part-time and two full time assistants at the library. Altogether there are 22,000 books - 16,000 adult and 6,000 junior. The most popular adult author is Catherine Cookson and romance is the favourite subject. There are 2,100 adult members and 856 junior members. Five local schools use the library on a regular basis. These include two Special Schools and a Physically Handicapped Unit from the High School. Other library services include Storytime, School Holiday activities and regular surgeries held by a social worker and a probation officer. Apart from books, the library lends audio-cassettes and a range of pictures and illustrations.
